    <article class="markdown-body entry-content" itemprop="mainContentOfPage"><table data-table-type="yaml-metadata">
  <thead>

  <th>title</th>

  <tbody>
  <tr>
  <td><div>Reproducible Research: Peer Assessment 1</div></td>

  <td><div>Troy Rose </div></td>

  <td><div><table>
  <thead>
  <tr>
  <th>html_document</th>

  <tbody>
  <tr>
  <td><div><table>

</table></div></td>

</table></div></td>
  </tr>
  </tbody>
</table><h2>
<a id="user-content-loading-and-preprocessing-the-data" class="anchor" href="#loading-and-preprocessing-the-data" aria-hidden="true"><span class="octicon octicon-link"></span></a>Loading and preprocessing the data</h2>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre>library(<span class="pl-vo">dplyr</span>)
library(<span class="pl-vo">ggplot2</span>)
<span class="pl-vo">activitydata</span><span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span>read.csv(<span class="pl-s1"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>C:<span class="pl-cce">\\</span>Users<span class="pl-cce">\\</span>troy<span class="pl-cce">\\</span>Desktop<span class="pl-cce">\\</span>repdata-data-activity<span class="pl-cce">\\</span>activity.csv<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)
<span class="pl-c"># translate time interval to %H:%M</span>
<span class="pl-en">translate</span><span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span><span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-vo">x</span>){
    <span class="pl-k">return</span>(paste(sprintf(<span class="pl-s1"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>%02d<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, trunc(<span class="pl-vo">x</span> <span class="pl-k">/</span> <span class="pl-c1">100</span>)),<span class="pl-s1"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>:<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, sprintf(<span class="pl-s1"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>%02d<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-vo">x</span> <span class="pl-k">%%</span> <span class="pl-c1">100</span>), <span class="pl-v">sep</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s1"><span class="pl-pds">"</span><span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>))
}
<span class="pl-c"># apply to interval to create "time" field</span>
<span class="pl-vo">activitydata</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-vo">time</span><span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span>lapply(<span class="pl-vo">activitydata</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-vo">interval</span>, <span class="pl-vo">translate</span>)

<span class="pl-c"># create datetime field</span>
<span class="pl-vo">activitydata</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-vo">datetime</span><span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span>as.POSIXct(strptime(paste(<span class="pl-vo">activitydata</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-vo">date</span>, <span class="pl-s1"><span class="pl-pds">"</span> <span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-vo">activitydata</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-vo">time</span>), <span class="pl-v">format</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s1"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>%Y-%m-%d %H:%M<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>))
</pre></div>

<h2>
<a id="user-content-what-is-mean-total-number-of-steps-taken-per-day" class="anchor" href="#what-is-mean-total-number-of-steps-taken-per-day" aria-hidden="true"><span class="octicon octicon-link"></span></a>What is mean total number of steps taken per day?</h2>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre><span class="pl-c"># group, summarise, removing missing values</span>
<span class="pl-vo">activitydata.by.day</span><span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span>group_by(<span class="pl-vo">activitydata</span>, <span class="pl-vo">date</span>)
<span class="pl-vo">summary.activitydata.by.day</span><span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span>summarise(<span class="pl-vo">activitydata.by.day</span>, <span class="pl-v">total</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> sum(<span class="pl-vo">steps</span>))
qplot(<span class="pl-vo">summary.activitydata.by.day</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-vo">total</span>, <span class="pl-v">geom</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s1"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>histogram<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)
<span class="pl-vo">meansteps</span><span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span>mean(<span class="pl-vo">summary.activitydata.by.day</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-vo">total</span>, <span class="pl-v">na.rm</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">TRUE</span>)
<span class="pl-vo">mediansteps</span><span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span>median(<span class="pl-vo">summary.activitydata.by.day</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-vo">total</span>, <span class="pl-v">na.rm</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">TRUE</span>)
</pre></div>

<p>80
The mean steps per day is <code>r meansteps</code>.</p>

<p>The median steps per day is <code>r mediansteps</code>.</p>

<h2>
<a id="user-content-what-is-the-average-daily-activity-pattern" class="anchor" href="#what-is-the-average-daily-activity-pattern" aria-hidden="true"><span class="octicon octicon-link"></span></a>What is the average daily activity pattern?</h2>

<pre lang='r,echoresult="false"'><code># group, summarise, removing missing values
activitydata.by.interval&lt;-group_by(activitydata,interval)
summary.activitydata.by.interval&lt;-summarise(activitydata.by.interval, mean = mean(steps, na.rm=TRUE))
qplot(summary.activitydata.by.interval$interval,summary.activitydata.by.interval$mean,ylab="Average number of steps per interval", xlab="5 minute intervals over 24 hours") + geom_line(aes(y = summary.activitydata.by.interval$mean), size = .5, alpha = 1)
maxmeansteps&lt;-max(summary.activitydata.by.interval$mean, na.rm=TRUE)
intmaxmeansteps&lt;-filter(summary.activitydata.by.interval, mean==maxmeansteps)$interval
</code></pre>

<p>The maximun of the mean total steps per day is <code>r maxmeansteps</code>.</p>

<p>The 5-minute interval that, on average, contains the maximum number of steps  is <code>r intmaxmeansteps</code>.</p>

<h2>
<a id="user-content-inputing-missing-values" class="anchor" href="#inputing-missing-values" aria-hidden="true"><span class="octicon octicon-link"></span></a>Inputing missing values</h2>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre><span class="pl-vo">totalnas</span><span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span>length(<span class="pl-vo">activitydata</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-vo">steps</span>[is.na(<span class="pl-vo">activitydata</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-vo">steps</span>)])

<span class="pl-en">fillnas</span><span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span><span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-vo">x</span>) {
        <span class="pl-k">if</span>(is.na(<span class="pl-vo">x</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-vo">steps</span>)) {
                trunc(filter(<span class="pl-vo">summary.activitydata.by.interval</span>, <span class="pl-vo">interval</span><span class="pl-k">==</span><span class="pl-vo">x</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-vo">interval</span>)<span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-vo">mean</span>)
        } <span class="pl-k">else</span> {
                <span class="pl-k">return</span>(<span class="pl-vo">x</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-vo">steps</span>)
        }
}
<span class="pl-vo">activitydata</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-vo">stepsfilled</span><span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span>apply(<span class="pl-vo">activitydata</span>, c(<span class="pl-c1">1</span>),<span class="pl-vo">fillnas</span>)

<span class="pl-vo">newactivitydata.by.day</span><span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span>group_by(<span class="pl-vo">activitydata</span>, <span class="pl-vo">date</span>)
<span class="pl-vo">summary.newactivitydata.by.day</span><span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span>summarise(<span class="pl-vo">newactivitydata.by.day</span>, <span class="pl-v">total</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> sum(<span class="pl-vo">steps</span>))
<span class="pl-c">#hist(summary.newactivitydata.by.day$total,  main = "Histogram of steps per day")</span>
qplot(<span class="pl-vo">summary.newactivitydata.by.day</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-vo">total</span>, <span class="pl-v">geom</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s1"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>histogram<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)
<span class="pl-vo">newmeansteps</span><span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span>mean(<span class="pl-vo">summary.newactivitydata.by.day</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-vo">total</span>, <span class="pl-v">na.rm</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">TRUE</span>)
<span class="pl-vo">newmediansteps</span><span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span>median(<span class="pl-vo">summary.newactivitydata.by.day</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-vo">total</span>, <span class="pl-v">na.rm</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">TRUE</span>)

</pre></div>

<p>Number of NAs for steps is <code>r totalnas</code>.</p>

<p>My strategy for sumplementing missing values for steps is:</p>

<ol>
<li>
<p>For all missing values:</p>

<pre><code>1. Replace the missing value with the average for that interval across all days truncated to a whole integer.
</code></pre>
</li>
</ol>

<p>The new steps filled in are stored in activitydata$stepsfilled.</p>

<p>The mean steps per day is <code>r newmeansteps</code>.</p>

<p>The median steps per day is <code>r newmediansteps</code>.</p>

<p>It does not appear that filling in the missing values of steps made very much difference to the overall mean and median steps per day.</p>

<h2>
<a id="user-content-are-there-differences-in-activity-patterns-between-weekdays-and-weekends" class="anchor" href="#are-there-differences-in-activity-patterns-between-weekdays-and-weekends" aria-hidden="true"><span class="octicon octicon-link"></span></a>Are there differences in activity patterns between weekdays and weekends?</h2>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre>
<span class="pl-c"># create new factor with two levels for days of week in weekend and weekday</span>
<span class="pl-vo">activitydata</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-vo">dayofweek</span><span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span><span class="pl-st">factor</span>(c(<span class="pl-s1"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>weekend<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-s1"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>weekday<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-c1">NA</span>))

<span class="pl-c"># fill in values for weekends and weekdays</span>
<span class="pl-vo">activitydata</span>[<span class="pl-k">!</span>(weekdays(as.Date(<span class="pl-vo">activitydata</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-vo">date</span>)) <span class="pl-k">%in%</span> c(<span class="pl-s1"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Saturday<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>,<span class="pl-s1"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Sunday<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>)),]<span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-vo">dayofweek</span><span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span>as.factor(<span class="pl-s1"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>weekday<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)
<span class="pl-vo">activitydata</span>[(weekdays(as.Date(<span class="pl-vo">activitydata</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-vo">date</span>)) <span class="pl-k">%in%</span> c(<span class="pl-s1"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Saturday<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>,<span class="pl-s1"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Sunday<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>)),]<span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-vo">dayofweek</span><span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span>as.factor(<span class="pl-s1"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>weekend<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)

<span class="pl-c"># group by day of week and interval</span>
<span class="pl-vo">activitydata.by.dayofweek</span><span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span>group_by(<span class="pl-vo">activitydata</span>, <span class="pl-vo">dayofweek</span>, <span class="pl-vo">interval</span>)

<span class="pl-c"># summarise data getting average of steps per day for each weekend and weekday</span>
<span class="pl-vo">summary.activitydata.by.dayofweek</span><span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span>summarise(<span class="pl-vo">activitydata.by.dayofweek</span>, <span class="pl-v">mean</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> mean(<span class="pl-vo">stepsfilled</span>))

<span class="pl-c"># plot data</span>
qplot(<span class="pl-vo">interval</span>, <span class="pl-vo">mean</span>, <span class="pl-v">data</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-vo">summary.activitydata.by.dayofweek</span>, <span class="pl-v">ylab</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s1"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Average number of steps per interval<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">xlab</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s1"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>5 minute intervals over 24 hours<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,<span class="pl-v">facets</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-vo">dayofweek</span> <span class="pl-k">~</span> . ) <span class="pl-k">+</span> geom_line(aes(<span class="pl-v">y</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-vo">summary.activitydata.by.dayofweek</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-vo">mean</span>), <span class="pl-v">size</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> .<span class="pl-c1">5</span>, <span class="pl-v">alpha</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span>)</pre></div>

<p>Yes, it appears that on weekends, there is less early morning activity, with peak activity occuring at around 8:00am, with very little activity prior to 8:00am (it appears that people like to sleep in on weekends).</p>

<p>This is different to the weekdays where morning activity starts at around 5:00am and peaks at around 9:00am. </p>

<p>End of analysis.</p>
</article>
